title: Worked Solution
text:
The wavelength $$\lambda$$ of a wave can be calculated using the relationship between the speed of light (c), the frequency (f), and the wavelength:

$$\lambda$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{c}{f}$$

Where:
- $$\(c$$ $$=$$ $$3.00$$ $$	imes$$ $${10}^8$$ $$\$$, 	ext{m/s}\) $$is$$ $$the$$ $$speed$$ $$of$$ $$light.$$
- $$\(f$$ $$=$$ $$2.83$$ $$	imes$$ 10**{20} $$\$$, 	ext{s}**{-1}\) $$is$$ $$the$$ $$frequency$$ $$of$$ $$the$$ $$gamma$$ $$rays.$$

Let's first calculate the wavelength in meters:

$$\lambda$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{3.00$$ $$	imes$$ $${10}^8$$ $$\$$, 	ext{m/s}}{2.83 $$	imes$$ 10**{20} $$\$$, 	ext{s}**{-1}}$$

Now, performing the calculation:

$$\lambda$$ $$=$$ $$1.06$$ $$	imes$$ 10**{-12} $$\$$, $$	ext{m}$$

Next, to convert the wavelength from meters to nanometers, recall that:

$$1$$ $$\$$, $$	ext{nm$$} $$=$$ $$1$$ $$	imes$$ 10**{-9} $$\$$, $$	ext{m}$$

Thus, converting to nanometers:

$$\lambda$$ $$=$$ $$1.06$$ $$	imes$$ 10**{-12} $$\$$, $$	ext{m$$} $$	imes$$ $$ rac{1$$ $$\$$, $$	ext{nm}}{1$$ $$	imes$$ 10**{-9} $$\$$, $$	ext{m}$$} $$=$$ $$1.06$$ $$\$$, $$	ext{nm}$$

Final Answers:
- Wavelength in meters: $$\(1.06$$ $$	imes$$ 10**{-12} $$\$$, $$	ext{m}\)$$
- Wavelength in nanometers: $$\(1.06$$ $$\$$, $$	ext{nm}\)$$
